00032 #ifndef CONSTRAINT_ABS_H
00033 #define CONSTRAINT_ABS_H
00034 
00035 // X = abs(Y)
00036 template<typename AbsVarRef1, typename AbsVarRef2>
00037 struct AbsConstraint : public AbstractConstraint
00038 {
00039   virtual string constraint_name()
00040   { return "Abs"; }
00041   
00042   AbsVarRef1 var1;
00043   AbsVarRef2 var2;
00044   AbsConstraint(StateObj* _stateObj, AbsVarRef1 _var1, AbsVarRef2 _var2) : AbstractConstraint(_stateObj),
00045     var1(_var1), var2(_var2)
00046   {}
00047   
00048   virtual triggerCollection setup_internal()
00049   {
00050     triggerCollection t;
00051     t.push_back(make_trigger(var1, Trigger(this, 1), UpperBound));
00052     t.push_back(make_trigger(var1, Trigger(this, 2), LowerBound));
00053     t.push_back(make_trigger(var2, Trigger(this, 3), UpperBound));
00054     t.push_back(make_trigger(var2, Trigger(this, 4), LowerBound));
00055     return t;
00056   }
00057 
00058   virtual void full_propagate()
00059   {
00060     var1.setMin(0);
00061     for(int i = 0; i < 4 && !getState(stateObj).isFailed(); ++i)
00062       propagate(i, 0);
00063   }
00064   
00065   // Assume values passed in in order.
00066   DomainInt absmax(DomainInt x, DomainInt y)
00067   {
00068     D_ASSERT(x <= y);
00069     if(x < 0)
00070       x *= -1;
00071     if(y < 0)
00072       y *= -1;
00073     return max(x, y);
00074   }
00075   
00076   // Assume values passed in in order.
00077   DomainInt absmin(DomainInt x, DomainInt y)
00078   {
00079     D_ASSERT(x <= y);
00080     if(x <= 0)
00081     {
00082       if(y >= 0)
00083         return 0;
00084       else
00085       {
00086         return -y;
00087       }
00088     }
00089     else
00090       return x;
00091     
00092   }
00093   
00094   virtual void propagate(int i, DomainDelta)
00095   {
00096     // Assume this in the algorithm.
00097     D_ASSERT(var1.getMin() >= 0);
00098     
00099     PROP_INFO_ADDONE(Abs);
00100     switch(i)
00101     {
00102     case 1: //var1 upper
00103       var2.setMax(var1.getMax());
00104       var2.setMin(-var1.getMax());
00105       return;
00106     case 2: //var1 lower
00107       if(var2.getMax() < var1.getMin())
00108         var2.setMax(-var1.getMin());
00109       if(var2.getMin() > -var1.getMin())
00110         var2.setMin(var1.getMin());
00111       else
00112         var2.setMin(-var1.getMax());
00113       return;
00114     case 3: //var 2 upper
00115     case 4: //var 2 lower
00116       var1.setMax(absmax(var2.getMin(), var2.getMax()));
00117       var1.setMin(absmin(var2.getMin(), var2.getMax()));  
00118       if(var2.getMin() > -var1.getMin())
00119         var2.setMin(var1.getMin());
00120       return;
00121 
00122     }
00123   }
00124   
00125   
00126   virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int v_size)
00127   {
00128     D_ASSERT(v_size == 2);
00129     if(v[1] >= 0)
00130       return v[0] == v[1];
00131     else
00132       return v[0] == -v[1];
00133   }
00134   
00135   virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
00136   {
00137     DomainInt x_dom_max = var1.getMax();
00138     DomainInt y_dom_max = max(abs(var2.getMin()), abs(var2.getMax()));
00139     DomainInt dom_max = min(x_dom_max, y_dom_max);
00140     DomainInt dom_min = max(DomainInt(0), max(var1.getMin(), var2.getMin()));
00141 
00142     for(DomainInt i = dom_min; i <= dom_max; ++i)
00143     {
00144       if( var1.inDomain(i) )
00145       {
00146         if( var2.inDomain(i) )
00147         {
00148           assignment.push_back(make_pair(0, i));
00149           assignment.push_back(make_pair(1, i));
00150           return true;
00151         }
00152         else
00153         if( var2.inDomain(-i) )
00154         {
00155           assignment.push_back(make_pair(0, i));
00156           assignment.push_back(make_pair(1, -i));
00157           return true;
00158         }
00159       }
00160     }
00161     return false;
00162   }
00163   
00164   
00165   virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
00166   { 
00167     vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
00168     vars.reserve(2);
00169     vars.push_back(var1);
00170     vars.push_back(var2);
00171     return vars;
00172   }
00173   
00174   
00175      // Function to make it reifiable in the lousiest way.
00176   virtual AbstractConstraint* reverse_constraint()
00177   {
00178       vector<AnyVarRef> t;
00179       t.push_back(var1);
00180       t.push_back(var2);
00181       return new CheckAssignConstraint<vector<AnyVarRef>, AbsConstraint>(stateObj, t, *this);
00182   }
00183 };
00184 
00185 template<typename EqualVarRef1, typename EqualVarRef2>
00186 AbstractConstraint*
00187 AbsCon(StateObj* stateObj, EqualVarRef1 var1, EqualVarRef2 var2)
00188 { return new AbsConstraint<EqualVarRef1, EqualVarRef2>(stateObj, var1,var2); }
00189 
00190 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00191 AbstractConstraint*
00192 BuildCT_ABS(StateObj* stateObj, const T1& t1, const T2& t2, ConstraintBlob&) 
00193 { return AbsCon(stateObj, t1[0],t2[0]); }
00194 
00195 #endif
